sentence.text: To investigate genetic predispositions for positive regulation of gene expression-amplified neuroblastoma, we performed a meta-analysis of three genome-wide association studies totaling 615 MYCN-amplified high-risk neuroblastoma cases and 1869 MYCN-nonamplified non-high-risk neuroblastoma cases as controls using a fixed-effects model with inverse variance weighting.

We identified a novel locus at 3p21.31 indexed by the single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) rs80059929 (odds ratio [OR] = 2.95, 95% confidence interval [CI] = 2.17 to 4.02, Pmeta = 6.47 x 10-12) associated with positive regulation of gene expression-amplified neuroblastoma, which was replicated in 127 MYCN-amplified cases and 254 non-high-risk controls (OR = 2.30, 95% CI = 1.12 to 4.69, Preplication = .02).

Additionally, the previously reported positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II neuroblastoma risk locus was statistically significant only in patients with MYCN-nonamplified high-risk tumors (OR = 0.63, 95% CI = 0.53 to 0.75, Pmeta = 1.51 x 10-8; Pmeta = .95).

entity.text: positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Our results indicate that common genetic variation predisposes to different neuroblastoma genotypes, including the likelihood of somatic positive regulation of gene expression-amplification
